Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a WebSocket server class for peer-to-peer communication that handles connections, messages, and room management.

Class Description: The SnapdropServer class represents a WebSocket server that facilitates peer-to-peer communication. It manages WebSocket connections, handles incoming messages, and maintains rooms for peer grouping. The server also handles connection headers and keeps connections alive.

Attributes:
- _wss: [WebSocket.Server] - The WebSocket server instance
- _rooms: [Object] - A dictionary tracking peers grouped by their IP addresses (rooms)

Methods:
- constructor(port: number) -> void - Initializes the WebSocket server on the specified port and sets up event handlers
- _onConnection(peer: Peer) -> void - Handles new WebSocket connections, sets up message handlers, and joins the peer to a room
- _onHeaders(headers: Array, response: Object) -> void - Processes HTTP headers during WebSocket handshake, setting cookies if needed
- _onMessage(sender: Peer, message: string) -> void - Handles incoming messages from peers, routing them to appropriate recipients
- _send(peer: Peer, message: Object) -> void - Sends a message to a specific peer over WebSocket connection
- _joinRoom(peer: Peer) -> void - Adds a peer to their respective room (Not shown in reference but implied)
- _leaveRoom(peer: Peer) -> void - Removes a peer from their room (Not shown in reference but implied)
- _keepAlive(peer: Peer) -> void - Maintains connection with periodic pings (Not shown in reference but implied)
